text: Ahh that's a shame. Going away by yourself is part of the fun of uni! I definitely couldnt cook, wash clothes etc when I left home at 18!! Someone in my uni halls tried to grill his pasta (i.e. he didnt soak it in water first) ... so funny haha
It's also not up to your parents after you turn 18 :wink:
I was homesick too at first, but you make friends so quickly and everyone is in the same boat as you so people are friendly and open and welcoming. But i respect that you might not feel like going
Work placement is definitely recommended! so thats great Brunel offer it, but I deffo encourage you to think BIGGER and HIGHER up the university rankings. You have so much potential girly!!

But im here for you whatever you choose, and we will get you there!! As I said, i can help with personal statements and all that stuff, so we'll put in the work and get you where you need to go :muscle:
Like you say, the work placements sound good quality, and the placement was definitely the best part of my degree (in my opinion)
